content.rendered:
AqualisBraemar has completed the jacket installation engineering of an 1800T steel jacket structure offshore Bahrain as part of the Bahrain LNG Import Terminal.

AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, delivered the project in cooperation with APMC, who were in charge of the transportation and installation contract on behalf of its EPC contractor client, GS E&C. AqualisBraemar was contracted by GS E&C to provide loadout, transport and offshore installation of the jacket.

Tow jacket 5km to site

AqualisBraemar’s scope of work provided full engineering services related to the loadout,transportation and float off operation, towing, positioning, lowering to the seabed and buoyancy tank removal, including all marine procedures. The offshore installation was executed in May 2018. The contract value is undisclosed.

An innovative approach for jacket installation in shallow water was applied by engineering buoyancy tanks to allow the jacket structure to be floated-off the transport vessel, towed to site and lowered to the seabed through ballasting. This negated the need for mobilising any large installation crane vessel.

Ballast tanks to lower jacket

“The jacket, with three of six main piles slotted into the jacket legs, and its buoyancy tanks were loaded out onto pre-installed grillages on the submersible Heavy Lift vessel using trailers,” says Phil Lenox, director – Asia Pacific, AqualisBraemar.

The Wish WayHeavy Lift vessel was utilised to transport the jacket from SKMT (Samkang M&T) in Goseong Yard, South Korea to its destination at its final location offshore Bahrain at 20 metres water depth.

“On arrival, the Heavy Lift vessel was ballasted down for the jacket to be floated off at a suitable nearby site and towed 5km to the installation location in shallow water. Following positioning between the breakwater and jetty structure, the buoyancy tanks were ballasted to lower the jacket to the seabed. After driving the main piles, the buoyancy tanks were removed from the jacket structure by releasing connecting pins and deballasting the tanks for recovery,” adds Lenox.

AqualisBraemar managed the jacket installation project out of its Singapore office. The associated topside floatover installation will be executed in August 2018.

 

For further information, please contact:

Other media enquiries

Endre Johansen, Corporate Communications AS
Telephone: +47 41 61 06 05
Email: endre.johansen@corpcom.no

About Aqualis ASA

Aqualis ASA (OSE: Aqua) is a public company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers energy consultancy services to the offshore oil, gas and renewables sectors globally. The group employs experienced consultants across 17 offices in 14 countries worldwide. Aqualis ASA operates under two different brands: AqualisBraemar and Offshore Wind Consultants. AqualisBraemar is a specialised offshore marine and engineering consultancy firm, focusing on the shallow and deep-water offshore segments of the oil and gas industry. Offshore Wind Consultants is a globally focused consultancy providing independent services to the offshore renewables industry.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar completes Bahrain floatover
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has completed the floatover installation of the REGAS topside offshore Bahrain as part of the Bahrain LNG Import Terminal.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar breaks into Indian rig moving market

jetpack-related-posts.title: UK offshore wind job for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 30 March 2016 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has been contracted by A2SEA to perform engineering consultancy services for its offshore wind farm installation work at the Race Bank Offshore Wind Farm offshore the UK. AqualisBraemar’s London office will provide engineering services including geotechnical and structural site assessments…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar opens office in Abu Dhabi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 19 February 2014 – New offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues its expansion in the Middle East and opens an office in Abu Dhabi. Just nine months after starting operations in the Middle East, AqualisBraemar has established offices in Dubai, UAE (regional headquarters); Dammam, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia; Bahrain;…

jetpack-related-posts.title: New head of Middle East for Aqualis
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 30 August 2016 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Ben Lazenby as director of the company’s Middle East operation, which now counts five offices in four different countries. Ben Lazenby succeeds Reuben Segal, who will now concentrate fully on his role as Chief Operating Officer of AqualisBraemar.…

jetpack-related-posts.title: FPSO topside warranty survey job for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 25 February 2016 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has been contracted by Cantex Global Logistics to provide the marine warranty surveyor (MWS) services for FPSO P67 & P70 topside modules transportation from various Brazilian ports to COOEC’s yard in Qingdao, China.
